thread.title: Slacking Demand for Traditional Cars Hurts Auto Makers - WSJ

author: Adrienne Roberts
title: Slacking Demand for Traditional Cars Hurts Auto Makers - WSJ

organizations.name: slacking demand for traditional cars hurts auto makers - wsj detroit

text:
Detroit auto makers on Tuesday reported mixed U.S. auto sales for April as demand for conventional passenger cars, such as sedans, continues to wither.
After an unexpectedly strong March, vehicle sales are expected to show a drop in April when more auto makers report later Tuesday, partly because of two fewer selling days than last year. But analysts say April results also will reflect a number of factors keeping sales from their highs of recent years, including higher monthly payments and a proliferation of late-model used...
